basics.name: Abdulrahman Yousif
basics.label: Project Executive & Mechanical Engineering
basics.summary: Mechanical Engineer With a master’s degree. Passionate about sustainability, Engineering as well as Project Management with strong technical, business, and interpersonal skills and experience for working in a team and successfully completing engineering and commissioning projects.

work.summary: EAG Consulting is Green Building Consultant specialized in offering a set of professional green building services related to green building certification and green building strategy.
highlights: As a Project executive I revamped Project management by introducing concepts such as planning and execution via agile sprints as well as introducing and training users to adapt optimized project management tools such as Asana.
Worked with engineering firms & other clients in assisting with the review of mechanical system design & automation in order to develop and maintain sustainable systems with low Carbon footprints.
Assisted multiple Clients in pursing Green Building Index (GBI) and United States Green Building Council LEED certifications.
Assisted in the Modeling of projects with simulation software such as IES and OpenFOAM, in order to provide optimized designs to achieve a lower total building energy consumption.
Provide enhanced commissioning services (GBI CxS and LEED CxA) to ensure installed building systems and services perform as designed and comply with the green building certifications’ requirements.

work.summary: Fluxmatics specializes in providing engineering solutions that require advanced engineering and advanced analysis tools with an emphasis on affordable results and new technologies.
highlights: Designed and Conducted CFD simulations in single and multi-phase flows in ANSYS Fluent, OpenFOAM and Star-CCM+.
I've enjoyed setting up and adapting technologies such as ANSYS Fluent and openFOAM and learned a lot about networking, budgeting and conducting negotiations.

work.summary: Taylor's University offers courses in tertiary education, from foundation and diploma to degree, post-graduate and professional programs.
highlights: Carried out an ecological footprint study on the usage of Solar hybrid power systems a regional island.
Utilised ANSYS Fluent to conduct a study on fluid flow-solar heat interaction.

work.summary: Universiti Teknologi PETRONAS places a strong emphasis on research and development. The university is a wholly owned subsidiary of PETRONAS, the national oil company of Malaysia.
highlights: Participated in a Flow Assurance Consulting project for PETRONAS Research by evaluating aged flow assurance equipment and preparing an advisory usage report.
Co-supervised several undergraduate projects including: ”Investigation on stability mechanism and behaviour of waxy crude oil emulsion and the rag layer from Malay basin.”

work.summary: Managed a team of 16 students on building two cars for the shell Eco-Marathon Asia 2012  with results receiving international media attention.
highlights: Proposed the project and worked with Faculty supervision in securing $15,000 of project funding.
Led the design team in jointly designing, testing and building an energy-efficient concept city car.
Led day to day and overall project plan and supervison of 16 students team by utilizing MS Project.

Participated in the Manufacturing of the two cars for the shell Eco-Marathon Asia by utilizing Technical Skills such as MIG welding and Lathe turinging, also took the opportunity in transferring those skills to new students.

volunteer.summary: Provide Assistance to SPE in translating glossary terms, articles, and papers from English into other languages.

awards.title: Full Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Research Scholarship for the full duration of the study

awards.title: Final Year Project Award for Best poster and presentation
awards.summary: Dean's Award for best poster and presentation of Graduating Projects of 2012.

awards.title: National EIMARace 2009 and 2010
awards.summary: The annual Educational Innovation in Motor-sport and Automotive Race is based on the International Formula SAE and is a National competition.

publications.name: CFD Modelling and Validation of Newtonian and Non-Newtonian Fluids in Curved Conduits
publications.summary: Details the results of CFD modelling of drag reduction agents polymer additives dissolved in a Newtonian solvent.

publications.name: Effects of Polymer Addition to a Newtonian Solvent in Horizontal Pipe Flow
publications.summary: A series of experiments in a flow loop to experimentally determine and investigate the flow behaviour of various types of Non-Newtonian shear thinning fluid in turbulent flow while relating the behaviour to its rheological characteristics.

references.name: Assoc. Prof. Dr. Azuraien Bt. Japper-Jaafar
references.reference: He has proven that through hard work and dedication, he can accomplish the given tasks in an excellent and timely manner.

references.name: Dr. Mark Ovnis
references.reference: I would rank him in the Top 10% of the postgraduate students that I have interacted with.
